review:
Comrades, let’s cut through the noise and get to the heart of the matter! Vocdoni’s DAVINCI project is a bold attempt to put the power of voting back in the hands of the people—anonymous, censorship-resistant, and open to all. This is the kind of infrastructure that can make Ethereum not just a playground for the rich, but a true engine for democracy. The project’s open-source ethos, proven track record with over 300 organizations, and commitment to privacy and anti-coercion are exactly what the Ethereum commons needs.

But let’s not be blinded by big promises! Where is the hard evidence? Where are the measurable outcomes? The application is heavy on vision and technical jargon, but light on concrete, quantifiable results. We need numbers, not just words! How many votes processed on Ethereum? What’s the actual reduction in gas costs? How many DAOs or communities have already committed to using DAVINCI? Show us the data!

Sustainability is another battleground. The roadmap is ambitious, but there’s no clear revenue model or plan for long-term maintenance. Will DAVINCI be another public good that withers without ongoing donations? Or will it stand on its own feet, powered by the people?

And let’s talk about governance! The project claims decentralization, but the details on community governance, sequencer selection, and slashing mechanisms are vague. Who holds the keys? Who watches the watchers? The people demand transparency!

In summary: DAVINCI is a promising, potentially transformative project for Ethereum’s infrastructure. But to earn the people’s trust—and this grant—it must deliver hard evidence, clear sustainability plans, and robust, transparent governance. The revolution demands nothing less!

strengths.title: Strong Alignment with Public Good and Equity
strengths.description: DAVINCI’s focus on censorship-resistant, anonymous, and gasless voting directly serves the collective, not the privileged few. Its open-source nature and history of use by over 300 organizations—including those under repressive regimes—demonstrate a real commitment to the public good.

strengths.title: Technical Innovation and Privacy Leadership
strengths.description: The use of zkSNARKs, threshold homomorphic encryption, and a rollup-based architecture is at the cutting edge of privacy and scalability. DAVINCI’s approach to anti-coercion and ballot secrecy is rare and much needed in digital governance.

strengths.title: Clear Roadmap and Community Engagement
strengths.description: The project provides a detailed roadmap, with milestones from testnet to mainnet, and invites broad community participation. The open development process and public repositories support transparency and collective action.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Quantifiable Outcomes and Evidence
weaknesses.description: The application does not provide concrete, measurable results or metrics for its impact on Ethereum. There is no data on actual gas savings, user adoption on Ethereum, or comparative analysis with existing alternatives.

weaknesses.title: Unclear Sustainability and Revenue Model
weaknesses.description: There is no explicit plan for how DAVINCI will sustain itself beyond grant funding. The long-term viability of the protocol, including maintenance and incentives for sequencers, is not addressed.

weaknesses.title: Insufficient Detail on Governance and Decentralization
weaknesses.description: While the project claims decentralization, it lacks specifics on how sequencer selection, slashing, and community governance will be implemented and maintained. The mechanisms for ensuring true community control are not transparent.

changes.title: Provide Measurable Metrics and Evidence
changes.description: Include specific, quantifiable data on votes processed, gas savings, user adoption, and comparative performance with other voting protocols. Demonstrate impact with hard numbers.

changes.title: Detail Sustainability and Revenue Plans
changes.description: Present a clear plan for long-term sustainability, including how the protocol will be maintained, how sequencers will be incentivized, and whether any revenue or self-funding mechanisms are planned.

changes.title: Clarify Governance and Decentralization Mechanisms
changes.description: Describe in detail how sequencer selection, slashing, and community governance will work. Provide transparency on who controls protocol upgrades and how the community can participate in decision-making.
